View HNG Service Parameters

Use this task to create HetNet Gateway (HNG) GSM 2G or LTE 4G cell service parameters.

  1. From the navigation bar, select HNG Details.
  2. In the window that appears, complete the following applicable fields to view service parameters for an HNG:

    Name

    Description
    Select HNG Name drop-down list Default is the only valid selection at this time.
    Select Service Type drop-down list Select LTE or GSM as the service type for cell traffic coming from this HNG device.
    Select LTE Service Name drop-down list

    This field appears if you selected LTE as the service type for this HNG.

    A Virtual eNodeB (VeNB) instance supports LTE services to the cell from the PW EMS.

    Select from the following VeNBs:
    • venb1
    • venb2
    Select GSM Service Name drop-down list This field appears if you selected GSM as the service type for this HNG. Select the available GSM service profile. For example vbsc1.
    Select GPRS Service Name drop-down list This field appears if you selected GSM as the service type for this HNG. Select the General Packet Radio Service (GPRS) QoS profile that contains DSCP values for packet-oriented mobile back-haul data network traffic. For example, vpcu1. If there is no profile for this, select none.
  3. View the following parameter values that are displayed for HNG LTE 4G service below:

    Name

    Description
    Search field Enter a HNG LTE 4G service parameter on which to search.
    venbName The VeNB instance that you selected.
    enbId

    The E-UTRAN Node B (eNB) ID.
    s1ServerIPList List of S1 server instances and their respective IP addresses.
    s1Port The SCTP Destination port number value assigned by IANA to be used for S1 Application Protocol (S1AP) interface on the eNB module is 36412, which is used across all managers in the LTE environment.
    role The role of the s1 port is for an eNB module.
    enbIdPool Displays whether or not there is an eNB identifier (ID) pool. The enB ID is used to locally identify User Equipment (UE) within an Mobility Management Entity (MME) group that is unique within an MME Pool.
    primaryPlmn Displays the primary Public Land Mobile Network (PLMN) wireless communications system. For example, 002-01.
    secondaryPlmns Displays the secondary PLMN wireless communications system.
    tacs List of Tracking Area Code (TAC) instances for indicating the Traffic area in which the VeNB belongs. This TAC is unique within the PLMN.
    defaultPagingDrx

    The default paging-drx value of 256 radio frames to all cells connected to an HNG (same veNB) through the veNB zone.
  4. View the following parameter values that are displayed for HNG GSM 2G service:

    Name

    Description
    VBSC Click to expand the configured virtual Base Station Controller (BSC) values.
    vbscName Name of the VBSC network element that controls and monitors a number of base stations and provides the interface between the cell sites and the mobile switching center (MSC).
    abisServerIp The IP address of the GSM network server that controls radio equipment and radio frequency allocation in the BTS.
    abisport The GSM network interface used between the BTS and BSC.
    primaryPlmn Displays the primary Public Land Mobile Network (PLMN) wireless communications system. For example, 002-01.
    secondaryPlmns Displays the secondary PLMN wireless communications system.
    lacs Click to expand the GSM Location Area Code (LAC) instances, which have a hexadecimal identifier (ID) value of 0 to 9, a to f, A to F.
Parent topic: Device Configuration and Management
